universities.name: University of Engineering and Technology (UET) Lahore

scholarships.title: In-affordability Scholarship
scholarships.description: Scholarships awarded on the basis of poverty-cum-merit by the Scholarship Award Committee.

scholarships.title: Fee Concession and Other Financial Assistance
scholarships.description: Free ship in tuition fees may be granted to a maximum of 15 deserving students.
rules: Granted on recommendation of the Scholarships Award Committee.
When two or more siblings are studying, one pays full fee and the other pays half.

scholarships.title: Free Ship in Rationalized Fee
scholarships.description: Ten students in each department run on rationalized fee structure will receive scholarships on merit/need basis.
scholarships.benefits: Rs. 21,000/- per semester (first semester only). Scholarship holders must pay normal fee/user charges.

scholarships.title: Cash Awards to Talented Students
scholarships.description: Cash awards granted to students securing first, second, and third position in each semester of all disciplines.

scholarships.title: Award for the Best Student Project
scholarships.description: Award for final-year students for best project work in each discipline.
benefits: Cash prize
Certificate
Shield (kept in the department)
rules: Evaluated by a departmental Selection Committee.

scholarships.title: Gold Medal
scholarships.description: Gold medal awarded to students meeting excellence criteria.
criteria: Pass all exams in first attempt.
Stand first in aggregate marks in their discipline.
scholarships.note: In case of tie, multiple gold medals may be awarded.

scholarships.title: Presidential Awards
scholarships.description: Two cash prizes awarded by the President of Pakistan.
eligibility: One student from Tribal Areas
One student from Settled Districts
Highest position in Bachelor of Engineering Examination

scholarships.title: University Merit Scholarships
scholarships.description: Awarded to students in specific semesters based on academic performance.
eligibility: B.Sc Engineering: 3rd, 5th, 7th semesters
B.Arch: 5th, 7th, 9th semesters
Based on results of preceding examinations.
Not receiving any other scholarship/financial assistance.
CGPA not less than 2.00.

scholarships.title: Financial Assistance from External Agencies
scholarships.description: Financial assistance for deserving students provided by various organizations.

providers.name: National Bank of Pakistan Loan Scheme
Chief Minister Scholarships for needy students

scholarships.title: IIUI HEC Need Based Scholarships (Undergraduate)
eligibility: Available for all disciplines at public sector Pakistani universities.
Must be enrolled in a 4/5 year undergraduate program through merit-based admission.
Selection based on financial need as determined by HEC’s Institutional Scholarship Award Committee.
benefits: Full university tuition fee coverage.
Rs. 6,000 monthly stipend (excluding summer semester).
Funding continues for the entire program; slots are replaced if a student drops out.

scholarships.title: IIUI Student Advancement Fund Endowment (SAFE)
eligibility: Open to IIUI’s needy and talented students.
Selection based on SAFE committee’s policy.
benefits: Provides financial aid and funds capacity-building projects.
Benefits are directly for enrolled students.
Fund is part of IIUI’s official endowment.

scholarships.title: University Merit Scholarships (CGPA 4/4)
eligibility: CGPA of 4.0 with maximum course load and no failed courses.
No outstanding fees or disciplinary record.
Only top 3 position holders in class are eligible.
benefits: Tuition fee waiver: 1st (100%), 2nd (75%), 3rd (50%).
Applied for the relevant semester only.
If availing another scholarship, remaining fee is refunded/adjusted.

details.number_of_awards: 100 scholarships, divided among schools based on admission rankings
details.criteria: Top-ranked applicants per school based on admissions (e.g., SAT, A-Level marks)
details.coverage: Partial to full tuition for one year

details.awarded_to: Top students per school based on CGPA and placement on the Dean's Honor List

typical_breakdown.required_cgpa: ~3.85-3.95+ depending on the school and year

student_perspectives.quote: 1-3 students from each school get a 100% scholarship, while 10-15 get 50%. For first year, based on O/A-Level and SAT (near-perfect grades + 1500+ SAT)... After first year, based on CGPA—those above 3.85 usually fall in this category.
Top 15 students of each school: top 3 get 100%, rest get 50%.
You need to be one of the top 15 in the batch... around a 3.9+ GPA.

programs.name: MS Programs (e.g., MS Biology, Computer Science, AI)

details.coverage: Partial to full tuition waiver for one year; renewed based on performance

details.for_programs: Four Basic Sciences (Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Mathematics)
details.benefit: Flat tuition subsidy (waiver) for MS students—automatically awarded

gmat_gre_based.or: 50% waiver for top admission evaluation ranking

details.basis: Merit-based partial tuition waiver to top-performing students on the Dean's Honor List

details.benefit: 50% tuition waiver to high-merit female applicants. Replaces any lesser scholarship

details.duration: Awards applied for the entire two-year duration

data.award: Full merit award for entire program

scholarships.title: Rehmatul-Lil-Alameen Scholarship
scholarships.description: Scholarship to assist bright and underprivileged students affected by COVID-19 who cannot afford education.
scholarships.funding_resource: Higher Education Department (HED), Government of Punjab
scholarships.financial_support: Determined by HED after comprehensive evaluation.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Students do not need to apply. Nominations are forwarded by UE Divisions/Campus and Financial Aid Office to HED.

scholarships.title: Ehsaas Undergraduate Scholarship
scholarships.description: Government of Pakistan initiative providing financial support to undergraduate students from poor households.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers 100% tuition fee plus Rs. 40,000 per annum stipend.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online at https://ehsaas.hec.gov.pk/#/login and submit printed form with documents to FAO Coordinator.

scholarships.title: HEC Need Based Scholarship
scholarships.description: Supports financially disadvantaged students to access higher education.
scholarships.financial_support: Tuition fee + Rs. 6000 per month stipend for entire program.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Get and submit form to FAO Coordinator after announcement. Download from HEC website.

scholarships.title: Punjab Educational Endowment Fund (PEEF) Master Level Scholarship
scholarships.description: PEEF provides scholarships to talented but deserving students for master’s level education.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers tuition fee, stipend, and hostel fee (paid bi-annually).
scholarships.how_to_apply: Obtain form from FAO Coordinator or PEEF website and submit with required documents.

scholarships.title: PEEF Bachelor Level Scholarship
scholarships.description: PEEF selects students based on intermediate results and sends nomination letters to their addresses.
scholarships.financial_support: As decided by PEEF.
scholarships.how_to_apply: PEEF contacts selected students directly after result verification.

scholarships.title: Karwan-e-Ilm Scholarship
scholarships.description: Provides financial help to deserving students securing 75%+ marks in Matric/Intermediate.
scholarships.financial_support: Decided by KIF Committee after evaluation.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Submit handwritten application with documents to FAO Coordinator after announcement.

scholarships.title: Diya Pakistan Scholarship
scholarships.description: Supports financially distressed students to continue education and reduce poverty.
scholarships.financial_support: Determined by Diya Scholarship Committee based on degree expenses.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through https://diyapak.org/apply-scholarship/

scholarships.title: Bait-ul-Maal Scholarship
scholarships.description: Provides stipends to deserving students in recognized educational institutions across Punjab.
scholarships.financial_support: Decided by District Bait-ul-Maal Committee based on degree expenses.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Submit prescribed form to Chairman, District Bait-ul-Maal Committee. Form available at link below.

scholarships.title: Balochistan Education Endowment Fund (BEEF) Scholarship
scholarships.description: Awards scholarships to meritorious students from Balochistan to develop human resource for national progress.
scholarships.financial_support: Determined by BEEF after comprehensive evaluation.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Obtain and submit form with documents to FAO Coordinator after announcement.

scholarships.title: Prime Minister’s Electric Wheelchair Scheme
scholarships.description: Provides electric wheelchairs to disabled students of public universities to support their education.
scholarships.financial_support: Distribution of motorized wheelchairs.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online via https://eportal.hec.gov.pk/wheelchair and submit printed form to FAO Coordinator.

scholarships.title: UE Merit Based Scholarship
scholarships.description: Semester-wise merit scholarship for top three BS and Master’s students of the University of Education, Lahore.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers tuition fee depending on position: 100%, 75%, or 50%.
scholarships.how_to_apply: No application required. UE prepares and finalizes list of eligible students automatically based on results.

schemes.name: Scheme-I
benefits: Stipend of Rs. 40,000 per month (Engineering Departments)
Stipend of Rs. 20,000 per month (Faculty of Computing & Artificial Intelligence)
100% Tuition Fee Waiver
Career progression through Lab Engineer, Teaching/Research Assistant, Post-doc, and faculty positions
schemes.eligibility: Minimum CGPA of 3.5 in Bachelor Degree

schemes.name: Scheme-II
benefits: 100% Tuition Fee Waiver
Teaching Assistant/Research Assistant role required
schemes.eligibility: Minimum CGPA of 3.5 in Bachelor Degree

schemes.name: Scheme-III
benefits: 50% Tuition Fee Waiver
Departmental duties as assigned by Head of Department
schemes.eligibility: Minimum CGPA of 3.0 in Bachelor Degree

scholarships.note: All fee waivers are subject to continued academic performance.

benefits: Full or Partial Fee Waiver
Opportunity to work on industry/research projects such as Data Sharing for Aerial Vehicles, GSM Security, Sensor Fusion for Mobile Nodes
scholarships.eligibility: CGPA 3.0 or above in relevant bachelor degree

scholarships.category: Need & Merit Based Financial Aid Schemes
scholarships.overview: AU invites applications every Fall semester for financial grants based on student need and merit. Aid depends on availability of funds.
grants: Air University Need Based Financial Grant (AUNBFG)
Incentive Financial Grant (IFG) for AU Multan Campus

steps: Apply for financial grant along with admission form at AU portal.
After admission confirmation, submit documents to Financial Aid Office within 15 days of semester start.
Late applicants can apply within 15 days of semester start via Registrar.
Spring semester students can apply in next Fall semester.
eligibility: Admitted on open merit only.
Minimum CGPA of 2.0 required to continue grant.
Only one need-based grant allowed per student.
Disciplinary actions or unfair means make student ineligible.
Specific criteria apply for Ehsaas, PEEF, and HEC grants.
PAF ward discount: 25% tuition fee rebate (requires documentation).
AU Employee discount: 50% rebate (for non-probationary employees admitted on open merit).

special_cases: IFG: Offered to AU Multan Campus students; reviewed annually.
HEC Employee Ward Discount: 50% Tuition Fee Concession for wards of HEC regular employees.

eligibility: Minimum SGPA of 3.5
Full-time student with full course load
No summer semester awards
No disciplinary punishment
Not for final semester students
If tied positions occur, all are awarded respective position reward
Combined awards cannot exceed 100% of tuition fee
Minimum SGPA of 3.75
Full-time with regular workload
No summer/thesis awards
No disciplinary punishment
Award total cannot exceed 100% of tuition fee
Tied positions receive respective position rewards

scholarships.procedure: Financial Aid Office processes merit scholarships within two months of result announcement. Award is adjusted in fee or refunded via draft.

universities.university: National University of Computer and Emerging Sciences (FAST-NUCES)

scholarships.title: Merit Scholarships for Bachelor Students
scholarships.description: Awarded to the top three position holders of each Examination Board in the year of admission, and the top three students in the NU admission merit list.
scholarships.financial_support: Full tuition fee waiver for four years of uninterrupted studies with full course load.
scholarships.eligibility: Students must maintain a semester GPA of 3.0 or higher to continue receiving the scholarship.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Automatically awarded based on merit; no separate application required.

scholarships.title: HEC Scholarships for MS and PhD Students
scholarships.description: Scholarships provided by the Higher Education Commission (HEC) for MS and PhD degree students.
scholarships.funding_resource: Higher Education Commission (HEC), Government of Pakistan
scholarships.financial_support: Covers tuition fee, monthly stipend, and book allowance.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Students can apply through HEC when the scholarships are announced.

scholarships.title: Punjab Educational Endowment Fund (PEEF) Scholarships
scholarships.description: Government of Punjab scholarships for indigent students domiciled in Punjab, newly admitted in any FAST-NU campus.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers a portion of tuition fee for 4-year undergraduate studies. Remaining fee may be given by the university as Qarz-e-Hasna.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Eligible students may apply through campus administration after admission.

scholarships.title: Sindh Government Endowment Board Scholarships
scholarships.description: Need-cum-merit scholarships for Karachi campus students at undergraduate and graduate levels.
scholarships.financial_support: Full tuition fee for entire program duration; renewable every year. 60% quota for rural students, 40% for urban.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Students can apply when applications open each year; about 25 new scholarships are offered annually.

scholarships.title: Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Education Foundation (KPEF) Scholarship
scholarships.description: Scholarships for Peshawar campus students on need-cum-merit basis for BS and MS studies.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers 80% of tuition fees for the entire duration of the program.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through the KPEF website when the annual call is announced. Selected applicants are interviewed on campus.

scholarships.title: Balochistan Government Endowment Board Scholarship
scholarships.description: Need-cum-merit scholarships for Karachi campus students at undergraduate and graduate levels.
scholarships.financial_support: Full tuition fee for the entire program duration, renewable annually.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Students can apply when the Balochistan Endowment Board announces its scholarship cycle.

scholarships.title: OSAF Financial Assistance (Study Loan)
scholarships.description: Financial assistance arranged by the Old Students Association of FAST (OSAF) for students unable to afford their full tuition fee.
scholarships.financial_support: Partial or full financial assistance depending on need.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through the Financial Aid Office of the university.

scholarships.title: Other Community-Based Scholarships
scholarships.description: Various scholarships provided by community groups and foundations such as Memon Community, Bohra Community, INFAQ Foundation, and Agha Khan Foundation.
scholarships.financial_support: Varies depending on sponsoring organization.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Students can apply to specific community organizations offering scholarships.

scholarships.title: Assistantships
scholarships.description: Students are given paid assistantships for rendering services in different university departments and activities.
scholarships.financial_support: Monetary compensation for services provided.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Interested students can apply through relevant university departments.

scholarships.title: Bank Loans
scholarships.description: Educational loan facilities offered through partner banks.
scholarships.funding_resource: PICIC Commercial Bank, NIB Bank, Bank Alfalah, Bank Islami, MCB
scholarships.financial_support: Loan amount and repayment terms vary by bank.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply directly to participating banks for student loan programs.

scholarships.title: Study Loan / Financial Assistance
scholarships.description: Interest-free, need-based study loans for bright but financially challenged students.
scholarships.financial_support: Covers tuition fee only; renewable every semester based on performance. Discontinued if CGPA falls below minimum requirement.
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply using the prescribed form available from campus offices or the university website.

repayment_terms.start: Three months after graduation or upon employment, whichever is earlier.
repayment_terms.duration: Repayment within four years after graduation.
repayment_terms.conditions: Students must sign a contract authorizing employers to deduct repayments at source.

scholarships.application_form: Available for download from the university website.

contact.address: FAST-House, Rohtas Road, G-9/4, Islamabad - 44000, Pakistan

scholarships.name: Quaid-e-Azam Scholarship
scholarships.eligibility: BS Physics, Math, Econ, Chemistry with CGPA 2.5+

scholarships.name: Kinship Concession
scholarships.eligibility: Siblings in CUI with good academics

scholarships.name: BBA & BAF Scheme
scholarships.eligibility: Full or partial waiver based on criteria

scholarships.name: Mr. Abdul Wajid Scholarship from Zakat Fund / Financial Assistance
NED Alumni Association of Canada (NEDAC) Scholarship
NED ALUMNI SCHOLARSHIP (NED EE CS 94 95 Batch)
Prof. Dr. Mahmood Khan Pathan Scholarship
M. Farooq Siddiqui Scholarship / Financial Assistance
NED Alumni Association of South California (NEDAASC)
M. A Jalil Late & Mrs Nasreen Jalil Scholarship
Syed Asim Ahmed (Mechanical Batch-92-93) Memorial Scholarship
Mr. Sohail Ehtesham Scholarship / Financial Assistance (Zakat Fund)
Sher Bano & Gulrez Esbhani Scholarship. Kulsoom & Asghar Ali Ghanchi Scholarship
Prof. Abdul Azim Siddiqui Memorial Scholarship Program
New England NED Alumni Association Scholarship (NEDA - NE)
MaaJee Scholarship (Founded by Mr. Aftab Rizvi, NED Alumnus)
Mr. & Mrs Waseem Hamid Rizvi For Labia Naseem
Ms. Sayeedunisa M/O Mr. Hadi Ali (Maa Jee Endowment Fund)
Ms. Sultana Sher Ali M/O Mr. Nusrat Sher Ali (Maa Jee Endowment Fund)
